 This post is not quite accurate. First, the reason animals engage in homosexual sex is current under debate; claiming that they do not prefer sex with members of the same-sex is merely an as-of-yet unfounded opinion just as claiming that they do prefer it is. Further, if you have equal amounts of males and females in a society, some males will still engage in same-sex behaviors for many animals. This does not necessarily imply that it is their preferred form of sex.
 
 The idea that homosexuality cannot and does not occur in nature is certainly untrue. As the link to the article, and even Jaaaman's post suggest, in times when not many females are present we have absolutely seen long-term same-sex relationships occur in nature. Jaaaman might have made a claim which has not yet been proven false by claiming that homosexuality is not possible in nature when there are equal numbers of males and females. However even then it seems unlikely that the statement "cannot occur" is true, for a single mutation in the fruit fly drosophila can cause those flies to engage in sexual intercourse with males in preference to females. Whether such behavior "does" occur currently for the reason of mutation or otherwise is under debate.

 Also JakeCJB has posted other links as well:
 
 
The "deprived of heterosexuality" argument. A variation on the pseudo-heterosexuality argument, this argument postulates that lower ranked males are deprived of the opportunity to mate and therefore turn to other males for sexual satisfaction. 
 
 The problem with this argument is that in many species in which harem-guarding occurs, there is no difference between higher ranking males and lower ranking ones as to the frequency of their homosexual mountings. This has been demonstrated in musk oxen, American bison, and New Zealand sea lions among others. 
 
 Among female homosexual pairs of Japanese macaques and Hanuman langurs engaging in homosexual behaviors, males approaching the pair may be threatened or even attacked. 
 
 When homosexual bonding does occur in the absence of opposite sex pairs, members of such a pair often resist attempts to 'convert' them back into heterosexual relationships. Even when deprived of their bonded partner, white-fronted Amazon parrots will not revert, and long-eared hedgehogs have refused heterosexual partners for as long as two and a half years, much of their natural lifetime. In the case of Stellar's sea eagles and female barn owls, both housed without opposite sexed members of their species, homosexual pair bonds among females were strong enough that when inseminated, they coparented the chicks that resulted. 
 
 Homosexual bonds can be tight. Among male rhesus macaques, crab-eating macaques, bottlenosed dolphins, cheetahs and black-headed gulls with homosexual bonded partners, the members of the pair exhibited considerable distress at being separated from their partners. In all cases, the individuals ignored opposite sex partners offered them, and showed considerable joy and exhuberance at the reintroduction of their partners.
 
 http://www.bidstrup.com/sodomy.htm
 
 http://www.salon.com/it/feature/199...15featurea.html
 

 
 And another by JakeCJB: 
 
 
It appears most animal same-sex activity occurs with mounting...
 
 Affectionate activity often leads to, or is inseparable from, overtly sexual behavior--defined here as any contact between two or more animals involving genital stimulation. Stumptail and Crab-eating Macaques, for example, kiss their same-sex partners during sexual mounting. In fact, mounting is the most common type of sexual behavior found in homosexual contexts: one animal climbs on top of the other in a position similar to heterosexual intercourse, usually from behind in a front-to-back position (that is, one animal mounted on the back of the other). More than 95 percent of mammal and bird species use this position, for both male and female homosexual interactions.

 Regarding the "animals do it" argument, if you think about it, it really doesn't make any sense given that it's so far outside what a species usually does to propogate itself. It just doesn't jibe with the rest of evolutionary theory. I'm not going to deny it's been observed in nature--we know that to be the case.  That is a possibility, but it does not necessarily follow. Allow me to explain. First, in evolution, not all traits which are harmful are selected away. For example, let us look at sickle-cell anemia. This disease is very common in Africans but not in Americans. The reason for this is evolution! Hopefully you all remember your Mendelian genetics and Punnett Squares.
 
 Sicke-cell anemia is recessive, not dominant. So let's represent the trait using the letters S and s. This means that anyone with the genes SS or Ss doesn't have sickle-cell anemia, but anyone with the genes ss does. In America, natural selection has weeded out pretty much all of the s genes, the ones that cause sickle-cell anemia. This means that most people here are SS reproducing with SS resulting in only offspring of SS. In Africa, however, most people are Ss; two Ss people reproducing would have children that are 25% likely to be SS, 50% likely to be Ss, and 25% likely to be ss. 
 
 So why would natural selection not have weeded out that s gene in Africa as it did in America? Well it is because the gene is tied to something else; as it happens anyone who is heterozygous with the sickle-cell gene (anyone who has Ss) is immune to malaria. Malaria has been a much greater problem in Africa than in America, and because of this, people with the genes Ss have been more able to reproduce than people with the SS genes (people with the SS genes would never have children who are immune to malaria). 
 
 That is a very simple case; if sexual orientation is genetic, it is likely caused by a variety of genes, not just one. But should sexual orientation be at least partially genetic, homosexuality may have been maintained through evolution because because some heterozygous condition of it is beneficial to survival.
 
 It seems less likely, that homosexuality has survived because it is evolutionarily beneficial to the survival of the human species. It certainly may be the case that having a small subset of a human population which is attracted to members of the same sex is beneficial to the survival of that population. This group could perhaps exist to balance out families in subsocieties and subcultures where the number of males is greater or less than the number of females by a significant amount. These additional same-sex families could therefore have served to take in children who found themselves parentless, for whatever reason. It may further have been that in human societies, it was beneficial to have some members who did not need to care for children so that they might advance society in some other fashion.
 
 What the future holds for homosexuality is anyone's guess, but it does not indicate the most morally correct method of handling gay rights today.

Nobody here is "imposing" anything on you--I'm simply giving my opinion, which is all anyone ever does on a message board like this.

 
 It isn't quite true that you aren't forcing your opinion upon those here, assuming you vote. Because the people hold the power in a democracy, by holding the opinion that same-sex couples should not be allowed to marry and allowing that to affect your voting decisions, you are most certainly forcing those opinions upon others. You are pointing out certain people on this forum and saying, "you, you and you cannot marry the person you want to marry because of my religious belief." Even speaking out on an issue carries weight.
 
 
And no, for me religion IS the reason I believe that gay sex is wrong. But that might not be the reason for everyone.

 
 True, it may not be, but I will argue that if it is not religion then it is an arbitrary decision. Any who use morality or logic to judge gay rights cannot come to the conclusion that gay rights are wrong unless it is assumed that religion is always moral no matter how many people it hurts. Because not many people make such a decision arbitrarily, it is generally a safe bet that religion is behind disapproval of gay rights.
 
 
From an evolutionary and biological standpoint, that's exactly right.

 
 This may or may not be true of evolution, and it certainly is not biologically true. Evolution allows that which is best for the propogation of the species, and sex may very well increase the closeness of parents; tying them together.
 
 When talking Biology, pleasure can be considered a reason.

He avoids it because he knows full well that it actually is dirived from religious influence. Whether direct or indirect, it's still a religious assumption. 
 
 Basic mathmatical statistics prove that the more humans the more chance for a percentage will always be homosexual. We have seen various examples of how homosexuality is a natural occurance in several other species. We know that homosexuality alone is not a health risk. We know that homosexuals are just as likely to be able to reproduce as heterosexuals. 
 
 So he can't prove his assumption that homosexuality isn't natural, when infact we know with all certainty is more definitely is.

 
 And those religious influences are based on what he and all others like him has been taught since childhood. He is incapable of viewing it in any other manner. He seems to be incapable of independant reasoning. He is "brainwashed", refuses to acknowledge it, and wishes to brainwash others.
 
 If there is one thing I am against in organized religion, it is this very principle of brainwashing they use to control the masses.

And those religious influences are based on what he and all others like him has been taught since childhood. He is incapable of viewing it in any other manner. He seems to be incapable of independant reasoning. He is "brainwashed", refuses to acknowledge it, and wishes to brainwash others.
 
 If there is one thing I am against in organized religion, it is this very principle of brainwashing they use to control the masses.

 
 
 What bothers me the most about "organized religion" is the sheer hypocracy. I was taught that God instructs us to question authority, yet "the Church" brainwashes it's mass followers to not ever question authority, especially theirs. 
 I was taught that to not utilize the brain I was given was the unspoken sin of all sins. Yet organized religion forces it's followers to do just that, to not question authority, pooh-pooh science, and never think for themselves let alone following their hearts. 
 I cannot of good conciense as a parent allow my child to be subjected to that type of abuse. Spiritual abuse, abuse of the soul. How dare anyone expect me to do that to an innocent child? How dare anyone allow this to continually happen, even encourage it's existence is beyond compassionate comprehension. 
 But the fact that it does isn't shocking, it's just sickening.

You're right Justine. Organized religion has always been used by some people as crutch in order to feel superior to others. Why use your brain and heart if you don't have to? Because they are encouraged by their particular religion to behave this way, they think it's 'morally' alright. 'Sickening' is a good way to put it.

Homosexuality doesn't happen in nature.
 
 "Gay" animals are non existant. Animals that attempt to engage in sexual activities with other animals of the same sex are existant, but with reason. It usually involves the fact that no opposite sex counter-part is there and the animal becomes confused, or they are sexually playful, but never because its their prefered form of sexual intercourse. If you have equal amounts of Male and Female of the same species of Animal, not one of them will attempt to engage in sexual activity with another of the same sex.
 "Homosexuality" cannot, and does not occur in nature.

 
 although frogs do get hump happy on any object, alive or not!

Just a thought....
 
 Could homosexuality be the divine difference between Mankind and animals?
 
 Hmm...

Just a thought....
 
 Could homosexuality be the divine difference between Mankind and animals?
 
 Hmm...

 
 Lotsa gay animals out there, man. Wonder what Jaaaman's sources are. He seems very perturbed by homosexuality.

Just a thought....
 
 Could homosexuality be the divine difference between Mankind and animals?
 
 Hmm...

 
 
 I seriously doubt it. For that you would have to prove that animals ONLY have homosexual relationships and that Humans NEVER have. 
 Since neither can be done, it just means yours is a very bad therory.
